occupations.name: Soldier
occupations.description: You served in an army or militia, trained in combat and military tactics. War shaped you into what you are today.

occupations.name: Merchant
occupations.description: You bought and sold goods, traveling trade routes and negotiating deals. Coin and commerce were your trade.

occupations.name: Sailor
occupations.description: You worked on ships, whether as crew, navigator, or captain. The sea was your workplace and sometimes your battlefield.

occupations.name: Farmer
occupations.description: You worked the land, growing crops or raising livestock. Your life was dictated by seasons and weather.

occupations.name: Criminal
occupations.description: You made your living outside the law—as a thief, smuggler, or con artist. The shadows were your domain.

occupations.name: Entertainer
occupations.description: You performed for crowds—as a musician, actor, dancer, or storyteller. You lived to bring joy or provoke emotion.

occupations.name: Scholar
occupations.description: You dedicated yourself to study and research, whether in a university, library, or on your own. Knowledge was your pursuit.

occupations.name: Priest
occupations.description: You served a deity or faith, ministering to the faithful and performing sacred rites. Your life was one of devotion.

occupations.name: Artisan
occupations.description: You crafted goods with your hands—whether as a blacksmith, carpenter, weaver, or other tradesperson. Your skill was your living.

occupations.name: Hunter
occupations.description: You tracked and killed game for food and pelts, living off the land. The wilderness was your hunting ground.

occupations.name: Guard
occupations.description: You protected people or places—as a city guard, bodyguard, or caravan escort. Your job was to stand watch and keep others safe.

occupations.name: Miner
occupations.description: You worked underground, extracting ore and gems from the earth. The darkness and danger of the mines tested you daily.

occupations.name: Herbalist
occupations.description: You gathered and prepared plants for medicine and potions. Your knowledge of nature's remedies was sought after.

occupations.name: Scribe
occupations.description: You copied documents, kept records, or wrote letters for others. Your skill with words and writing was valuable.

occupations.name: Gambler
occupations.description: You made your living through games of chance and skill, taking risks for reward. Lady Luck was your patron.

occupations.name: Guide
occupations.description: You led others through dangerous or unfamiliar territory, using your knowledge of the land to keep them safe.

occupations.name: Gladiator
occupations.description: You fought for sport and spectacle in arenas, your life a constant battle for survival and glory.

occupations.name: Spy
occupations.description: You gathered information and secrets for those who paid you, working in the shadows to uncover what others wished to hide.

occupations.name: Wanderer
occupations.description: You had no fixed occupation, drifting from place to place and taking odd jobs. Freedom was more important than stability.

occupations.name: Noble
occupations.description: You were born or elevated to nobility, your occupation one of politics, management of estates, or military command.
